basics.name: José Miguel Gómez
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: Passionate full stack developer adept at leveraging cutting-edge technologies to create dynamic and user-friendly web experiences. Proficient in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and frameworks like React.js, Next.js and Astro. Committed to delivering innovative solutions that meet client needs and drive success in the digital space.

projects.name: Cortito
projects.description: Cortito is an open source full stack link shortener, it will create it easily and you can sign in with google or github to save, edit and delete your shortcuts with intuitive UI, also they have two views, as cards and as a list. It was made in Astro with React for Frontend and Express.js, Prisma and PostgreSQL for backend.
issues: This page uses the free render plan as its backend, so when creating a shortcut, after a while, you should wait around 50 seconds for the REST API to activate.

projects.name: Secrettito
projects.description: Secrettito is an open source web aplication for fun, you can create post where your friends will be able to send you anonymous messages, you might copy them easily or use native share, also it provide you a nice UX for watching the messages. Frontend and Backend are in a next.js web app with postgreSQL as database and Prisma as ORM.

references.reference: Thomas was hired as a lead developer and, upon the leaving of our co-founder took over as CTO of Earbits. Thomas is, hands down, one of those A Players you hear of companies dying to hire. He is incredibly smart, not just at code but about everything from classical music to Chinese language and culture. Thomas is great to work with and, as a well established contributor to open source projects and several successful ventures, commands the respect of engineers at all levels. I would suggest doing anything you can to have him on your team.
references.name: Joey Flores, Co-founder and CEO of Earbits, Inc.

work.summary: Tokenized is a Bitcoin wallet for issuing, managing and trading digital tokens. I built out the front end which was packaged as an electron app. It was a difficult frontend to build because we store the users keys locally and used them to sign transactions and contracts.
work.name: Tokenized
